content: 1 The word of the LORD that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the reigns of Kings Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah of Judah, and in the reign of King Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel.
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the reigns of Kings Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah of Judah, and in the reign of King Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel.

content: 2 When the LORD first spoke to Hosea, the LORD said to Hosea, “Go, get yourself a wife of whoredom and children of whoredom; for the land will stray from following the LORD.”
content_old: 2 When the LORD first spoke to Hosea, the LORD said to Hosea, “Go, get yourself a wife of whoredom and children of whoredom; for the land will stray from following the LORD.”

content: 3 So he went and married Gomer daughter of Diblaim. She conceived and bore him a son,
content_old: 3 So he went and married Gomer daughter of Diblaim. She conceived and bore him a son,

content: 4 and the LORD instructed him, “Name him Jezreel; for, I will soon punish the House of Jehu for the bloody deeds at Jezreel and put an end to the monarchy of the House of Israel.
content_old: 4 and the LORD instructed him, “Name him Jezreel; for, I will soon punish the House of Jehu for the bloody deeds at Jezreel and put an end to the monarchy of the House of Israel.

content: 5 In that day, I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
content_old: 5 In that day, I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”

content: 6 She conceived again and bore a daughter; and He said to him, “Name her Lo-ruhamah; for I will no longer accept the House of Israel or pardon them.
content_old: 6 She conceived again and bore a daughter; and He said to him, “Name her Lo-ruhamah; for I will no longer accept the House of Israel or pardon them.

content: 7 But I will accept the House of Judah. And I will give them victory through the LORD their God; I will not give them victory with bow and sword and battle, by horses and riders.”
content_old: 7 But I will accept the House of Judah. And I will give them victory through the LORD their God; I will not give them victory with bow and sword and battle, by horses and riders.”

content: 8 After weaning Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.
content_old: 8 After weaning Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.

content: 1 The number of the people of Israel shall be like that of the sands of the sea, which cannot be measured or counted; and instead of being told, “You are Not-My-People,” they shall be called Children-of-the-Living-God.
content_old: 1 The number of the people of Israel shall be like that of the sands of the sea, which cannot be measured or counted; and instead of being told, “You are Not-My-People,” they shall be called Children-of-the-Living-God.

content: 2 The people of Judah and the people of Israel shall assemble together and appoint one head over them; and they shall rise from the ground—for marvelous shall be the day of Jezreel!
content_old: 2 The people of Judah and the people of Israel shall assemble together and appoint one head over them; and they shall rise from the ground—for marvelous shall be the day of Jezreel!

content: 3 Oh, call your brothers “My People,” And your sisters “Lovingly Accepted!”
content_old: 3 Oh, call your brothers “My People,” And your sisters “Lovingly Accepted!”

content: 4 Rebuke your mother, rebuke her— For she is not My wife And I am not her husband— And let her put away her harlotry from her face And her adultery from between her breasts.
content_old: 4 Rebuke your mother, rebuke her— For she is not My wife And I am not her husband— And let her put away her harlotry from her face And her adultery from between her breasts.

content: 5 Else will I strip her naked And leave her as on the day she was born: And I will make her like a wilderness, Render her like desert land, And let her die of thirst.
content_old: 5 Else will I strip her naked And leave her as on the day she was born: And I will make her like a wilderness, Render her like desert land, And let her die of thirst.

content: 6 I will also disown her children; For they are now a harlot’s brood,
content_old: 6 I will also disown her children; For they are now a harlot’s brood,

content: 7 In that their mother has played the harlot, She that conceived them has acted shamelessly— Because she thought, “I will go after my lovers, Who supply my bread and my water, My wool and my linen, My oil and my drink.”
content_old: 7 In that their mother has played the harlot, She that conceived them has acted shamelessly— Because she thought, “I will go after my lovers, Who supply my bread and my water, My wool and my linen, My oil and my drink.”

content: 8 Assuredly, I will hedge up her roads with thorns And raise walls against her, And she shall not find her paths.
content_old: 8 Assuredly, I will hedge up her roads with thorns And raise walls against her, And she shall not find her paths.

content: 9 Pursue her lovers as she will, She shall not overtake them; And seek them as she may, She shall never find them. Then she will say, “I will go and return To my first husband, For then I fared better than now.”
content_old: 9 Pursue her lovers as she will, She shall not overtake them; And seek them as she may, She shall never find them. Then she will say, “I will go and return To my first husband, For then I fared better than now.”

content: 10 And she did not consider this: It was I who bestowed on her The new grain and wine and oil; I who lavished silver on her And gold—which they used for Baal.
content_old: 10 And she did not consider this: It was I who bestowed on her The new grain and wine and oil; I who lavished silver on her And gold—which they used for Baal.

content: 11 Assuredly, I will take back My new grain in its time And My new wine in its season, And I will snatch away My wool and My linen That serve to cover her nakedness.
content_old: 11 Assuredly, I will take back My new grain in its time And My new wine in its season, And I will snatch away My wool and My linen That serve to cover her nakedness.

content: 12 Now will I uncover her shame In the very sight of her lovers, And none shall save her from Me.
content_old: 12 Now will I uncover her shame In the very sight of her lovers, And none shall save her from Me.

content: 13 And I will end all her rejoicing: Her festivals, new moons, and sabbaths— All her festive seasons.
content_old: 13 And I will end all her rejoicing: Her festivals, new moons, and sabbaths— All her festive seasons.

content: 14 I will lay waste her vines and her fig trees, Which she thinks are a fee She received from her lovers; I will turn them into brushwood, And beasts of the field shall devour them.
content_old: 14 I will lay waste her vines and her fig trees, Which she thinks are a fee She received from her lovers; I will turn them into brushwood, And beasts of the field shall devour them.

content: 15 Thus will I punish her For the days of the Baalim, On which she brought them offerings; When, decked with earrings and jewels, She would go after her lovers, Forgetting Me —declares the LORD.
content_old: 15 Thus will I punish her For the days of the Baalim, On which she brought them offerings; When, decked with earrings and jewels, She would go after her lovers, Forgetting Me —declares the LORD.

content: 16 Assuredly, I will speak coaxingly to her And lead her through the wilderness And speak to her tenderly.
content_old: 16 Assuredly, I will speak coaxingly to her And lead her through the wilderness And speak to her tenderly.

content: 17 I will give her her vineyards from there, And the Valley of Achor as a plowland of hope. There she shall respond as in the days of her youth, When she came up from the land of Egypt.
content_old: 17 I will give her her vineyards from there, And the Valley of Achor as a plowland of hope. There she shall respond as in the days of her youth, When she came up from the land of Egypt.

content: 18 And in that day —declares the LORD— You will call Me Ishi, And no more will you call Me Baali.
content_old: 18 And in that day —declares the LORD— You will call Me Ishi, And no more will you call Me Baali.

content: 19 For I will remove the names of the Baalim from her mouth, And they shall nevermore be mentioned by name.
content_old: 19 For I will remove the names of the Baalim from her mouth, And they shall nevermore be mentioned by name.

content: 20 In that day, I will make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, the birds of the air, and the creeping things of the ground; I will also banish bow, sword, and war from the land. Thus I will let them lie down in safety.
content_old: 20 In that day, I will make a covenant for them with the beasts of the field, the birds of the air, and the creeping things of the ground; I will also banish bow, sword, and war from the land. Thus I will let them lie down in safety.

content: 21 And I will espouse you forever: I will espouse you with righteousness and justice, And with goodness and mercy,
content_old: 21 And I will espouse you forever: I will espouse you with righteousness and justice, And with goodness and mercy,

content: 22 And I will espouse you with faithfulness; Then you shall be devoted to the LORD.
content_old: 22 And I will espouse you with faithfulness; Then you shall be devoted to the LORD.

content: 23 In that day, I will respond —declares the LORD— I will respond to the sky, And it shall respond to the earth;
content_old: 23 In that day, I will respond —declares the LORD— I will respond to the sky, And it shall respond to the earth;

content: 24 And the earth shall respond With new grain and wine and oil, And they shall respond to Jezreel.
content_old: 24 And the earth shall respond With new grain and wine and oil, And they shall respond to Jezreel.

content: 1 The LORD said to me further, “Go, befriend a woman who, while befriended by a companion, consorts with others, just as the LORD befriends the Israelites, but they turn to other gods and love the cups of the grape.”
content_old: 1 The LORD said to me further, “Go, befriend a woman who, while befriended by a companion, consorts with others, just as the LORD befriends the Israelites, but they turn to other gods and love the cups of the grape.”

content: 2 Then I hired her for fifteen shekels of silver, a homer of barley, and a lethech of barley;
content_old: 2 Then I hired her for fifteen shekels of silver, a homer of barley, and a lethech of barley;

content: 3 and I stipulated with her, “In return, you are to go a long time without either fornicating or marrying; even I with you.”
content_old: 3 and I stipulated with her, “In return, you are to go a long time without either fornicating or marrying; even I with you.”

content: 4 For the Israelites shall go a long time without king and without officials, without sacrifice and without cult pillars, and without ephod and teraphim.
content_old: 4 For the Israelites shall go a long time without king and without officials, without sacrifice and without cult pillars, and without ephod and teraphim.

content: 1 Hear the word of the LORD, O people of Israel! For the LORD has a case Against the inhabitants of this land, Because there is no honesty and no goodness And no obedience to God in the land.
content_old: 1 Hear the word of the LORD, O people of Israel! For the LORD has a case Against the inhabitants of this land, Because there is no honesty and no goodness And no obedience to God in the land.

content: 2 swearing, dishonesty, and murder, And theft and adultery are rife; Crime follows upon crime!
content_old: 2 swearing, dishonesty, and murder, And theft and adultery are rife; Crime follows upon crime!

content: 3 For that, the earth is withered: Everything that dwells on it languishes— Beasts of the field and birds of the sky— Even the fish of the sea perish.
content_old: 3 For that, the earth is withered: Everything that dwells on it languishes— Beasts of the field and birds of the sky— Even the fish of the sea perish.

content: 4 “Let no man rebuke, let no man protest!” For this your people has a grievance against you, O priest!
content_old: 4 “Let no man rebuke, let no man protest!” For this your people has a grievance against you, O priest!

content: 5 So you shall stumble by day, And by night a prophet shall stumble as well, And I will destroy your kindred.
content_old: 5 So you shall stumble by day, And by night a prophet shall stumble as well, And I will destroy your kindred.

content: 6 My people is destroyed because of disobedience! Because you have rejected obedience, I reject you as My priest; Because you have spurned the teaching of your God, I, in turn, will spurn your children.
content_old: 6 My people is destroyed because of disobedience! Because you have rejected obedience, I reject you as My priest; Because you have spurned the teaching of your God, I, in turn, will spurn your children.

content: 7 The more they increased, the more they sinned against Me: I will change their dignity to dishonor.
content_old: 7 The more they increased, the more they sinned against Me: I will change their dignity to dishonor.

content: 8 They feed on My people’s sin offerings, And so they desire its iniquity.
content_old: 8 They feed on My people’s sin offerings, And so they desire its iniquity.

content: 9 Therefore, the people shall fare like the priests: I will punish it for its conduct, I will requite it for its deeds.
content_old: 9 Therefore, the people shall fare like the priests: I will punish it for its conduct, I will requite it for its deeds.

content: 10 Truly, they shall eat, but not be sated; They shall swill, but not be satisfied, Because they have forsaken the LORD To practice
content_old: 10 Truly, they shall eat, but not be sated; They shall swill, but not be satisfied, Because they have forsaken the LORD To practice

content: 11 lechery. Wine and new wine destroy The mind of
content_old: 11 lechery. Wine and new wine destroy The mind of

content: 12 My people: It consults its stick, Its rod directs it! A lecherous impulse has made them go wrong, And they have strayed from submission to their God.
content_old: 12 My people: It consults its stick, Its rod directs it! A lecherous impulse has made them go wrong, And they have strayed from submission to their God.

content: 13 They sacrifice on the mountaintops And offer on the hills, Under oaks, poplars, and terebinths Whose shade is so pleasant. That is why their daughters fornicate And their daughters-in-law commit adultery!
content_old: 13 They sacrifice on the mountaintops And offer on the hills, Under oaks, poplars, and terebinths Whose shade is so pleasant. That is why their daughters fornicate And their daughters-in-law commit adultery!

content: 14 I will not punish their daughters for fornicating Nor their daughters-in-law for committing adultery; For they themselves turn aside with whores And sacrifice with prostitutes, And a people that is without sense must stumble.
content_old: 14 I will not punish their daughters for fornicating Nor their daughters-in-law for committing adultery; For they themselves turn aside with whores And sacrifice with prostitutes, And a people that is without sense must stumble.

content: 15 If you are a lecher, Israel— Let not Judah incur guilt— Do not come to Gilgal, Do not make pilgrimages to Beth-aven, And do not swear by the LORD!
content_old: 15 If you are a lecher, Israel— Let not Judah incur guilt— Do not come to Gilgal, Do not make pilgrimages to Beth-aven, And do not swear by the LORD!

content: 16 Ah, Israel has balked Like a stubborn cow; Therefore, The LORD will graze him On the range, like a sheep.
content_old: 16 Ah, Israel has balked Like a stubborn cow; Therefore, The LORD will graze him On the range, like a sheep.

content: 17 Ephraim is addicted to images— Let him be.
content_old: 17 Ephraim is addicted to images— Let him be.

content: 18 They drink to excess— Their liquor turns against them. They “love” beyond measure— Disgrace is the “gift”
content_old: 18 They drink to excess— Their liquor turns against them. They “love” beyond measure— Disgrace is the “gift”

content: 1 Hear this, O priests, Attend, O House of Israel, And give ear, O royal house; For right conduct is your responsibility! But you have been a snare to Mizpah And a net spread out over Tabor;
content_old: 1 Hear this, O priests, Attend, O House of Israel, And give ear, O royal house; For right conduct is your responsibility! But you have been a snare to Mizpah And a net spread out over Tabor;

content: 2 For when trappers dug deep pitfalls, I was the only reprover of them all.
content_old: 2 For when trappers dug deep pitfalls, I was the only reprover of them all.

content: 3 Yes, I have watched Ephraim, Israel has not escaped my notice: Behold, you have fornicated, O Ephraim; Israel has defiled himself!
content_old: 3 Yes, I have watched Ephraim, Israel has not escaped my notice: Behold, you have fornicated, O Ephraim; Israel has defiled himself!

content: 4 Their habits do not let them Turn back to their God; Because of the lecherous impulse within them, They pay no heed to the LORD.
content_old: 4 Their habits do not let them Turn back to their God; Because of the lecherous impulse within them, They pay no heed to the LORD.

content: 5 Israel’s pride shall be humbled before his very eyes, As Israel and Ephraim fall because of their sin And Judah falls with them.
content_old: 5 Israel’s pride shall be humbled before his very eyes, As Israel and Ephraim fall because of their sin And Judah falls with them.

content: 6 Then they will go with their sheep and cattle To seek the LORD, but they will not find Him. He has cast them off:
content_old: 6 Then they will go with their sheep and cattle To seek the LORD, but they will not find Him. He has cast them off:

content: 7 they have broken faith with the LORD, Because they have begotten Alien children. Therefore, the new moon Shall devour their portion.
content_old: 7 they have broken faith with the LORD, Because they have begotten Alien children. Therefore, the new moon Shall devour their portion.

content: 8 Sound a ram’s horn in Gibeah, A trumpet in Ramah; Give the alarm in Beth-aven; After you, Benjamin!
content_old: 8 Sound a ram’s horn in Gibeah, A trumpet in Ramah; Give the alarm in Beth-aven; After you, Benjamin!

content: 9 Ephraim is stricken with horror On a day of chastisement. Against the tribes of Israel I proclaim certainties:
content_old: 9 Ephraim is stricken with horror On a day of chastisement. Against the tribes of Israel I proclaim certainties:

content: 10 The officers of Judah have acted Like shifters of field boundaries; On them I will pour out My wrath like water.
content_old: 10 The officers of Judah have acted Like shifters of field boundaries; On them I will pour out My wrath like water.

content: 11 Ephraim is defrauded, Robbed of redress, Because he has witlessly Gone after futility.
content_old: 11 Ephraim is defrauded, Robbed of redress, Because he has witlessly Gone after futility.

content: 12 For it is I who am like rot to Ephraim, Like decay to the House of Judah;
content_old: 12 For it is I who am like rot to Ephraim, Like decay to the House of Judah;

content: 13 Yet when Ephraim became aware of his sickness, Judah of his sores, Ephraim repaired to Assyria— He sent envoys to a patron king! He will never be able to cure you, Will not heal you of your sores.
content_old: 13 Yet when Ephraim became aware of his sickness, Judah of his sores, Ephraim repaired to Assyria— He sent envoys to a patron king! He will never be able to cure you, Will not heal you of your sores.

content: 14 No, I will be like a lion to Ephraim, Like a great beast to the House of Judah; I, I will attack and stride away, Carrying the prey that no one can rescue;
content_old: 14 No, I will be like a lion to Ephraim, Like a great beast to the House of Judah; I, I will attack and stride away, Carrying the prey that no one can rescue;

content: 1 “Come, let us turn back to the LORD: He attacked, and He can heal us; He wounded, and He can bind us up.
content_old: 1 “Come, let us turn back to the LORD: He attacked, and He can heal us; He wounded, and He can bind us up.

content: 2 In two days He will make us whole again; On the third day He will raise us up, And we shall be whole by His favor.
content_old: 2 In two days He will make us whole again; On the third day He will raise us up, And we shall be whole by His favor.

content: 3 Let us pursue obedience to the LORD, And we shall become obedient. His appearance is as sure as daybreak, And He will come to us like rain, Like latter rain that refreshes the earth.”
content_old: 3 Let us pursue obedience to the LORD, And we shall become obedient. His appearance is as sure as daybreak, And He will come to us like rain, Like latter rain that refreshes the earth.”

content: 4 What can I do for you, Ephraim, What can I do for you, Judah, When your goodness is like morning clouds, Like dew so early gone?
content_old: 4 What can I do for you, Ephraim, What can I do for you, Judah, When your goodness is like morning clouds, Like dew so early gone?

content: 5 That is why I have hewn down the prophets, Have slain them with the words of My mouth: And the day that dawned brought on your punishment.
content_old: 5 That is why I have hewn down the prophets, Have slain them with the words of My mouth: And the day that dawned brought on your punishment.

content: 6 For I desire goodness, not sacrifice; Obedience to God, rather than burnt offerings.
content_old: 6 For I desire goodness, not sacrifice; Obedience to God, rather than burnt offerings.

content: 7 But they, to a man, have transgressed the Covenant. This is where they have been false to Me:
content_old: 7 But they, to a man, have transgressed the Covenant. This is where they have been false to Me:

content: 8 Gilead is a city of evildoers, Tracked up with blood.
content_old: 8 Gilead is a city of evildoers, Tracked up with blood.

content: 9 The gang of priests is Like the ambuscade of bandits Who murder on the road to Shechem, For they have encouraged depravity.
content_old: 9 The gang of priests is Like the ambuscade of bandits Who murder on the road to Shechem, For they have encouraged depravity.

content: 10 In the House of Israel I have seen A horrible thing; Ephraim has fornicated there, Israel has defiled himself.
content_old: 10 In the House of Israel I have seen A horrible thing; Ephraim has fornicated there, Israel has defiled himself.

content: 1  When I would restore My people’s fortunes, When I would heal Israel, The guilt of Ephraim reveals itself And the wickedness of Samaria. For they have acted treacherously, With thieves breaking in And bands raiding outside.
content_old: 1  When I would restore My people’s fortunes, When I would heal Israel, The guilt of Ephraim reveals itself And the wickedness of Samaria. For they have acted treacherously, With thieves breaking in And bands raiding outside.

content: 2 And they do not consider That I remembered all their wickedness. Why, their misdeeds have been all around them, They have been ever before Me.
content_old: 2 And they do not consider That I remembered all their wickedness. Why, their misdeeds have been all around them, They have been ever before Me.

content: 3 In malice they make a king merry, And officials in treachery.
content_old: 3 In malice they make a king merry, And officials in treachery.

content: 4 They commit adultery, all of them, Like an oven fired by a baker, Who desists from stoking only From the kneading of the dough to its leavening.
content_old: 4 They commit adultery, all of them, Like an oven fired by a baker, Who desists from stoking only From the kneading of the dough to its leavening.

content: 5 The day they made our king sick officials with the poison of wine, He gave his hand to traitors.
content_old: 5 The day they made our king sick officials with the poison of wine, He gave his hand to traitors.

content: 6 For they approach their ambush With their hearts like an oven: Through the night Their baker has slept; In the morning, it flares up Like a blazing fire.
content_old: 6 For they approach their ambush With their hearts like an oven: Through the night Their baker has slept; In the morning, it flares up Like a blazing fire.

content: 7 They all get heated like an oven And devour their rulers— None of them calls to Me. All their kings have fallen.
content_old: 7 They all get heated like an oven And devour their rulers— None of them calls to Me. All their kings have fallen.

content: 8 Ephraim is among the peoples; He is rotting away. Ephraim is like a cake— Incapable of turning.
content_old: 8 Ephraim is among the peoples; He is rotting away. Ephraim is like a cake— Incapable of turning.

content: 9 Strangers have consumed his strength, But he has taken no notice; Also, mold is scattered over him, But he has taken no notice.
content_old: 9 Strangers have consumed his strength, But he has taken no notice; Also, mold is scattered over him, But he has taken no notice.

content: 10 Though Israel’s pride has been humbled Before his very eyes, They have not turned back To their God the LORD; They have not sought Him In spite of everything.
content_old: 10 Though Israel’s pride has been humbled Before his very eyes, They have not turned back To their God the LORD; They have not sought Him In spite of everything.

content: 11 Instead, Ephraim has acted Like a silly dove with no mind: They have appealed to Egypt! They have gone to Assyria!
content_old: 11 Instead, Ephraim has acted Like a silly dove with no mind: They have appealed to Egypt! They have gone to Assyria!

content: 12 When they go, I will spread My net over them, I will bring them down Like birds of the sky; I will chastise them When I hear their bargaining.
content_old: 12 When they go, I will spread My net over them, I will bring them down Like birds of the sky; I will chastise them When I hear their bargaining.

content: 13 Woe to them For straying from Me; Destruction to them For rebelling against Me! For I was their Redeemer; Yet they have plotted treason against Me.
content_old: 13 Woe to them For straying from Me; Destruction to them For rebelling against Me! For I was their Redeemer; Yet they have plotted treason against Me.

content: 14 But they did not cry out to Me sincerely As they lay wailing. They debauch over new grain and new wine, They are faithless to Me.
content_old: 14 But they did not cry out to Me sincerely As they lay wailing. They debauch over new grain and new wine, They are faithless to Me.

content: 15 I braced, I strengthened their arms, And they plot evil against Me!
content_old: 15 I braced, I strengthened their arms, And they plot evil against Me!

content: 1 a ram’s horn to your mouth— Like an eagle over the House of the LORD; Because they have transgressed My covenant And been faithless to My teaching.
content_old: 1 a ram’s horn to your mouth— Like an eagle over the House of the LORD; Because they have transgressed My covenant And been faithless to My teaching.

content: 2 Israel cries out to Me, “O my God, we are devoted to You.”
content_old: 2 Israel cries out to Me, “O my God, we are devoted to You.”

content: 3 Israel rejects what is good; An enemy shall pursue him.
content_old: 3 Israel rejects what is good; An enemy shall pursue him.

content: 4 They have made kings, But not with My sanction; They have made officers, But not of My choice. Of their silver and gold They have made themselves images, To their own undoing.
content_old: 4 They have made kings, But not with My sanction; They have made officers, But not of My choice. Of their silver and gold They have made themselves images, To their own undoing.

content: 5 He rejects your calf, Samaria! I am furious with them! Will they never be capable of purity?
content_old: 5 He rejects your calf, Samaria! I am furious with them! Will they never be capable of purity?

content: 6 For it was Israel’s doing; It was only made by a joiner, It is not a god. No, the calf of Samaria shall be Reduced to splinters!
content_old: 6 For it was Israel’s doing; It was only made by a joiner, It is not a god. No, the calf of Samaria shall be Reduced to splinters!

content: 7 They sow wind, And they shall reap whirlwind— Standing stalks devoid of ears And yielding no flour. If they do yield any, Strangers shall devour it.
content_old: 7 They sow wind, And they shall reap whirlwind— Standing stalks devoid of ears And yielding no flour. If they do yield any, Strangers shall devour it.

content: 8 Israel is bewildered; They have now become among the nations Like an unwanted vessel,
content_old: 8 Israel is bewildered; They have now become among the nations Like an unwanted vessel,

content: 9 a lonely wild ass. For they have gone up to Assyria, Ephraim has courted friendship.
content_old: 9 a lonely wild ass. For they have gone up to Assyria, Ephraim has courted friendship.

content: 10 And while they are courting among the nations, There I will hold them fast; And they shall begin to diminish in number From the burden of king and officers.
content_old: 10 And while they are courting among the nations, There I will hold them fast; And they shall begin to diminish in number From the burden of king and officers.

content: 11 For Ephraim has multiplied altars—for guilt; His altars have redounded to his guilt:
content_old: 11 For Ephraim has multiplied altars—for guilt; His altars have redounded to his guilt:

content: 12 The many teachings I wrote for him Have been treated as something alien.
content_old: 12 The many teachings I wrote for him Have been treated as something alien.

content: 13 When they present sacrifices to Me, It is but flesh for them to eat: The LORD has not accepted them. Behold, He remembers their iniquity, He will punish their sins: Back to Egypt with them!
content_old: 13 When they present sacrifices to Me, It is but flesh for them to eat: The LORD has not accepted them. Behold, He remembers their iniquity, He will punish their sins: Back to Egypt with them!

content: 1 Rejoice not, O Israel, As other peoples exult; For you have strayed Away from your God: You have loved a harlot’s fee By every threshing floor of new grain.
content_old: 1 Rejoice not, O Israel, As other peoples exult; For you have strayed Away from your God: You have loved a harlot’s fee By every threshing floor of new grain.

content: 2 Threshing floor and winepress Shall not join them, And the new wine shall betray her.
content_old: 2 Threshing floor and winepress Shall not join them, And the new wine shall betray her.

content: 3 They shall not be able to remain In the land of the LORD. But Ephraim shall return to Egypt And shall eat unclean food in Assyria.
content_old: 3 They shall not be able to remain In the land of the LORD. But Ephraim shall return to Egypt And shall eat unclean food in Assyria.

content: 4 It shall be for them like the food of mourners, All who partake of which are defiled. They will offer no libations of wine to the LORD, And no sacrifices of theirs will be pleasing to Him; But their food will be only for their hunger, It shall not come into the House of the LORD.
content_old: 4 It shall be for them like the food of mourners, All who partake of which are defiled. They will offer no libations of wine to the LORD, And no sacrifices of theirs will be pleasing to Him; But their food will be only for their hunger, It shall not come into the House of the LORD.

content: 5 What will you do about feast days, About the festivals of the LORD?
content_old: 5 What will you do about feast days, About the festivals of the LORD?

content: 6 Behold, they have gone from destruction With the silver they treasure. Egypt shall hold them fast, Moph shall receive them in burial. Weeds are their heirs; Prickly shrubs occupy their old homes.
content_old: 6 Behold, they have gone from destruction With the silver they treasure. Egypt shall hold them fast, Moph shall receive them in burial. Weeds are their heirs; Prickly shrubs occupy their old homes.

content: 7 The days of punishment have come For your heavy guilt; The days of requital have come— Let Israel know it! The prophet was distraught, The inspired man driven mad By constant harassment.
content_old: 7 The days of punishment have come For your heavy guilt; The days of requital have come— Let Israel know it! The prophet was distraught, The inspired man driven mad By constant harassment.

content: 8 Ephraim watches for my God. As for the prophet, Fowlers’ snares are on all his paths, Harassment in the House of his God.
content_old: 8 Ephraim watches for my God. As for the prophet, Fowlers’ snares are on all his paths, Harassment in the House of his God.

content: 9 They have been as grievously corrupt As in the days of Gibeah; He will remember their iniquity, He will punish their sins.
content_old: 9 They have been as grievously corrupt As in the days of Gibeah; He will remember their iniquity, He will punish their sins.

content: 10 I found Israel As grapes in the wilderness; Your fathers seemed to Me Like the first fig to ripen on a fig tree. But when they came to Baal-peor, They turned aside to shamefulness; Then they became as detested As they had been loved.
content_old: 10 I found Israel As grapes in the wilderness; Your fathers seemed to Me Like the first fig to ripen on a fig tree. But when they came to Baal-peor, They turned aside to shamefulness; Then they became as detested As they had been loved.

content: 11 From birth, from the womb, from conception Ephraim’s glory shall be Like birds that fly away.
content_old: 11 From birth, from the womb, from conception Ephraim’s glory shall be Like birds that fly away.

content: 12 Even if they rear their infants, I will bereave them of men. Woe to them indeed When I turn away from them!
content_old: 12 Even if they rear their infants, I will bereave them of men. Woe to them indeed When I turn away from them!

content: 13 It shall go with Ephraim As I have seen it go with Tyre, Which was planted in a meadow; Ephraim too must bring out His children to slayers.
content_old: 13 It shall go with Ephraim As I have seen it go with Tyre, Which was planted in a meadow; Ephraim too must bring out His children to slayers.

content: 14 Give them, O LORD—give them what? Give them a womb that miscarries, And shriveled breasts!
content_old: 14 Give them, O LORD—give them what? Give them a womb that miscarries, And shriveled breasts!

content: 15 All their misfortune began at Gilgal, For there I disowned them. For their evil deeds I will drive them out of My House. I will accept them no more; All their officials are disloyal.
content_old: 15 All their misfortune began at Gilgal, For there I disowned them. For their evil deeds I will drive them out of My House. I will accept them no more; All their officials are disloyal.

content: 16 Ephraim is stricken, Their stock is withered; They can produce no fruit. Even if they do bear children, I will slay their cherished offspring.
content_old: 16 Ephraim is stricken, Their stock is withered; They can produce no fruit. Even if they do bear children, I will slay their cherished offspring.

content: 1 Israel is a ravaged vine And its fruit is like it. When his fruit was plentiful, He made altars aplenty; When his land was bountiful, Cult pillars abounded.
content_old: 1 Israel is a ravaged vine And its fruit is like it. When his fruit was plentiful, He made altars aplenty; When his land was bountiful, Cult pillars abounded.

content: 2 Now that his boughs are broken up, He feels his guilt; He himself pulls apart his altars, Smashes his pillars.
content_old: 2 Now that his boughs are broken up, He feels his guilt; He himself pulls apart his altars, Smashes his pillars.

content: 3 Truly, now they say, “We have no king; For, since we do not fear the LORD, What can a king do to us?”
content_old: 3 Truly, now they say, “We have no king; For, since we do not fear the LORD, What can a king do to us?”

content: 4 So they conclude agreements and make covenants With false oaths, And justice degenerates into poison weeds, Breaking out on the furrows of the fields.
content_old: 4 So they conclude agreements and make covenants With false oaths, And justice degenerates into poison weeds, Breaking out on the furrows of the fields.

content: 5 The inhabitants of Samaria fear For the calf of Beth-aven; Indeed, its people and priestlings, Whose joy it once was, Mourn over it for the glory That is departed from it.
content_old: 5 The inhabitants of Samaria fear For the calf of Beth-aven; Indeed, its people and priestlings, Whose joy it once was, Mourn over it for the glory That is departed from it.

content: 6 It too shall be brought to Assyria As tribute to a patron king; Ephraim shall be chagrined, Israel shall be dismayed Because of his plans.
content_old: 6 It too shall be brought to Assyria As tribute to a patron king; Ephraim shall be chagrined, Israel shall be dismayed Because of his plans.

content: 7 Samaria’s monarchy is vanishing Like foam upon water,
content_old: 7 Samaria’s monarchy is vanishing Like foam upon water,

content: 8 Ruined shall be the shrines of aven, That sin of Israel. Thorns and thistles Shall grow on their altars. They shall call to the mountains, “Bury us!” To the hills, “Fall on us!”
content_old: 8 Ruined shall be the shrines of aven, That sin of Israel. Thorns and thistles Shall grow on their altars. They shall call to the mountains, “Bury us!” To the hills, “Fall on us!”

content: 9 You have sinned more, O Israel, Than in the days of Gibeah. There they stand as at Gibeah! Shall they not be overtaken By a war upon scoundrels
content_old: 9 You have sinned more, O Israel, Than in the days of Gibeah. There they stand as at Gibeah! Shall they not be overtaken By a war upon scoundrels

content: 10 As peoples gather against them? When I chose them, I broke them in, Harnessing them for two furrows.
content_old: 10 As peoples gather against them? When I chose them, I broke them in, Harnessing them for two furrows.

content: 11 Ephraim became a trained heifer, But preferred to thresh; I placed a yoke Upon her sleek neck. I will make Ephraim do advance plowing; Judah shall do main plowing! Jacob shall do final plowing!
content_old: 11 Ephraim became a trained heifer, But preferred to thresh; I placed a yoke Upon her sleek neck. I will make Ephraim do advance plowing; Judah shall do main plowing! Jacob shall do final plowing!

content: 12 “Sow righteousness for yourselves; Reap the fruits of goodness; Break for yourselves betimes fresh ground Of seeking the LORD, So that you may obtain a teacher of righteousness.”
content_old: 12 “Sow righteousness for yourselves; Reap the fruits of goodness; Break for yourselves betimes fresh ground Of seeking the LORD, So that you may obtain a teacher of righteousness.”

content: 13 You have plowed wickedness, You have reaped iniquity— you shall eat the fruits of treachery— Because you relied on your way, On your host of warriors.
content_old: 13 You have plowed wickedness, You have reaped iniquity— you shall eat the fruits of treachery— Because you relied on your way, On your host of warriors.

content: 14 But the din of war shall arise in your own people, And all your fortresses shall be ravaged As Beth-arbel was ravaged by Shalman On a day of battle, When mothers and babes were dashed to death together.
content_old: 14 But the din of war shall arise in your own people, And all your fortresses shall be ravaged As Beth-arbel was ravaged by Shalman On a day of battle, When mothers and babes were dashed to death together.

content: 1 I fell in love with Israel When he was still a child; And I have called My son Ever since Egypt.
content_old: 1 I fell in love with Israel When he was still a child; And I have called My son Ever since Egypt.

content: 2 Thus were they called, But they went their own way; They sacrifice to Baalim And offer to carved images.
content_old: 2 Thus were they called, But they went their own way; They sacrifice to Baalim And offer to carved images.

content: 3 I have pampered Ephraim, Taking them in My arms; But they have ignored My healing care.
content_old: 3 I have pampered Ephraim, Taking them in My arms; But they have ignored My healing care.

content: 4 I drew them with human ties, With cords of love; But I seemed to them as one Who imposed a yoke on their jaws, Though I was offering them food.
content_old: 4 I drew them with human ties, With cords of love; But I seemed to them as one Who imposed a yoke on their jaws, Though I was offering them food.

content: 5 No! They return to the land of Egypt, And Assyria is their king. Because they refuse to repent,
content_old: 5 No! They return to the land of Egypt, And Assyria is their king. Because they refuse to repent,

content: 6 A sword shall descend upon their towns And consume their limbs And devour them because of their designs.
content_old: 6 A sword shall descend upon their towns And consume their limbs And devour them because of their designs.

content: 7 For My people persists In its defection from Me; When it is summoned upward, It does not rise at all.
content_old: 7 For My people persists In its defection from Me; When it is summoned upward, It does not rise at all.

content: 8 How can I give you up, O Ephraim? How surrender you, O Israel? How can I make you like Admah, Render you like Zeboiim? I have had a change of heart, All My tenderness is stirred.
content_old: 8 How can I give you up, O Ephraim? How surrender you, O Israel? How can I make you like Admah, Render you like Zeboiim? I have had a change of heart, All My tenderness is stirred.

content: 9 I will not act on My wrath, Will not turn to destroy Ephraim. For I am God, not man, The Holy One in your midst: I will not come in fury.
content_old: 9 I will not act on My wrath, Will not turn to destroy Ephraim. For I am God, not man, The Holy One in your midst: I will not come in fury.

content: 10 The LORD will roar like a lion, And they shall march behind Him; When He roars, His children shall come Fluttering out of the west.
content_old: 10 The LORD will roar like a lion, And they shall march behind Him; When He roars, His children shall come Fluttering out of the west.

content: 1 Ephraim surrounds Me with deceit, The House of Israel with guile. (But Judah stands firm with God And is faithful to the Holy One.
content_old: 1 Ephraim surrounds Me with deceit, The House of Israel with guile. (But Judah stands firm with God And is faithful to the Holy One.

content: 2 Ephraim tends the wind And pursues the gale; He is forever adding Illusion to calamity. Now they make a covenant with Assyria, Now oil is carried to Egypt.
content_old: 2 Ephraim tends the wind And pursues the gale; He is forever adding Illusion to calamity. Now they make a covenant with Assyria, Now oil is carried to Egypt.

content: 3 The LORD once indicted Judah, And punished Jacob for his conduct, Requited him for his deeds.
content_old: 3 The LORD once indicted Judah, And punished Jacob for his conduct, Requited him for his deeds.

content: 4 In the womb he tried to supplant his brother; Grown to manhood, he strove with a divine being,
content_old: 4 In the womb he tried to supplant his brother; Grown to manhood, he strove with a divine being,

content: 5 He strove with an angel and prevailed— The other had to weep and implore him. At Bethel Jacobwould meet him, There to commune with him.
content_old: 5 He strove with an angel and prevailed— The other had to weep and implore him. At Bethel Jacobwould meet him, There to commune with him.

content: 6 Yet the LORD, the God of Hosts, Must be invoked as “LORD.”
content_old: 6 Yet the LORD, the God of Hosts, Must be invoked as “LORD.”

content: 7 You must return to your God! Practice goodness and justice, And constantly trust in your God.
content_old: 7 You must return to your God! Practice goodness and justice, And constantly trust in your God.

content: 8 A trader who uses false balances, Who loves to overreach,
content_old: 8 A trader who uses false balances, Who loves to overreach,

content: 9 Ephraim thinks, “Ah, I have become rich; I have gotten power! All my gains do not amount To an offense which is real guilt.”
content_old: 9 Ephraim thinks, “Ah, I have become rich; I have gotten power! All my gains do not amount To an offense which is real guilt.”

content: 10 I the LORD have been your God Ever since the land of Egypt. I will let you dwell in your tents again As in the days of old,
content_old: 10 I the LORD have been your God Ever since the land of Egypt. I will let you dwell in your tents again As in the days of old,

content: 11 When I spoke to the prophets; For I granted many visions, And spoke parables through the prophets.
content_old: 11 When I spoke to the prophets; For I granted many visions, And spoke parables through the prophets.

content: 12 As for Gilead, it is worthless; And to no purpose have they Been sacrificing oxen in Gilgal: The altars of these are also Like stone heaps upon a plowed field.
content_old: 12 As for Gilead, it is worthless; And to no purpose have they Been sacrificing oxen in Gilgal: The altars of these are also Like stone heaps upon a plowed field.

content: 13 Then Jacob had to flee to the land of Aram; There Israel served for a wife, For a wife he had to guard sheep.
content_old: 13 Then Jacob had to flee to the land of Aram; There Israel served for a wife, For a wife he had to guard sheep.

content: 14 But when the LORD Brought Israel up from Egypt, It was through a prophet; Through a prophet they were guarded.
content_old: 14 But when the LORD Brought Israel up from Egypt, It was through a prophet; Through a prophet they were guarded.

content: 1 When Ephraim spoke piety, He was exalted in Israel; But he incurred guilt through Baal, And so he died.
content_old: 1 When Ephraim spoke piety, He was exalted in Israel; But he incurred guilt through Baal, And so he died.

content: 2 And now they go on sinning; They have made them molten images, Idols, by their skill, from their silver, Wholly the work of craftsmen. Yet for these they appoint men to sacrifice; They are wont to kiss calves!
content_old: 2 And now they go on sinning; They have made them molten images, Idols, by their skill, from their silver, Wholly the work of craftsmen. Yet for these they appoint men to sacrifice; They are wont to kiss calves!

content: 3 Assuredly, They shall be like morning clouds, Like dew so early gone; Like chaff whirled away from the threshing floor. And like smoke from a lattice.
content_old: 3 Assuredly, They shall be like morning clouds, Like dew so early gone; Like chaff whirled away from the threshing floor. And like smoke from a lattice.

content: 4 Only I the LORD have been your God Ever since the land of Egypt; You have never known a true God but Me, You have never had a helper other than Me.
content_old: 4 Only I the LORD have been your God Ever since the land of Egypt; You have never known a true God but Me, You have never had a helper other than Me.

content: 5 I looked after you in the desert, In a thirsty land.
content_old: 5 I looked after you in the desert, In a thirsty land.

content: 6 When they grazed, they were sated; When they were sated, they grew haughty; And so they forgot Me.
content_old: 6 When they grazed, they were sated; When they were sated, they grew haughty; And so they forgot Me.

content: 7 So I am become like a lion to them, Like a leopard I lurk on the way;
content_old: 7 So I am become like a lion to them, Like a leopard I lurk on the way;

content: 8 Like a bear robbed of her young I attack them And rip open the casing of their hearts; I will devour them there like a lion, The beasts of the field shall mangle them.
content_old: 8 Like a bear robbed of her young I attack them And rip open the casing of their hearts; I will devour them there like a lion, The beasts of the field shall mangle them.

content: 9 You are undone, O Israel! You had no help but Me.
content_old: 9 You are undone, O Israel! You had no help but Me.

content: 10 Where now is your king? Let him save you! Where are the chieftains in all your towns Whom you demanded: “Give me a king and officers”?
content_old: 10 Where now is your king? Let him save you! Where are the chieftains in all your towns Whom you demanded: “Give me a king and officers”?

content: 11 I give you kings in my ire, And take them away in My wrath.
content_old: 11 I give you kings in my ire, And take them away in My wrath.

content: 12 Ephraim’s guilt is bound up, His sin is stored away.
content_old: 12 Ephraim’s guilt is bound up, His sin is stored away.

content: 13 Pangs of childbirth assail him, And the babe is not wise— For this is no time to survive At the birthstool of babes.
content_old: 13 Pangs of childbirth assail him, And the babe is not wise— For this is no time to survive At the birthstool of babes.

content: 14 From Sheol itself I will save them, Redeem them from very Death. Where, O Death, are your plagues? Your pestilence where, O Sheol? Revenge shall be far from My thoughts.
content_old: 14 From Sheol itself I will save them, Redeem them from very Death. Where, O Death, are your plagues? Your pestilence where, O Sheol? Revenge shall be far from My thoughts.

content: 1 Samaria must bear her guilt, For she has defied her God. They shall fall by the sword, Their infants shall be dashed to death, And their women with child ripped open.
content_old: 1 Samaria must bear her guilt, For she has defied her God. They shall fall by the sword, Their infants shall be dashed to death, And their women with child ripped open.

content: 2 Return, O Israel, to the LORD your God, For you have fallen because of your sin.
content_old: 2 Return, O Israel, to the LORD your God, For you have fallen because of your sin.

content: 3 Take words with you And return to the LORD. Say to Him: “Forgive all guilt And accept what is good; Instead of bulls we will pay The offering of our lips.
content_old: 3 Take words with you And return to the LORD. Say to Him: “Forgive all guilt And accept what is good; Instead of bulls we will pay The offering of our lips.

content: 4 Assyria shall not save us, No more will we ride on steeds; Nor ever again will we call Our handiwork our god, Since in You alone orphans find pity!”
content_old: 4 Assyria shall not save us, No more will we ride on steeds; Nor ever again will we call Our handiwork our god, Since in You alone orphans find pity!”

content: 5 I will heal their affliction, Generously will I take them back in love; For My anger has turned away from them.
content_old: 5 I will heal their affliction, Generously will I take them back in love; For My anger has turned away from them.

content: 6 I will be to Israel like dew; He shall blossom like the lily, He shall strike root like a Lebanon tree.
content_old: 6 I will be to Israel like dew; He shall blossom like the lily, He shall strike root like a Lebanon tree.

content: 7 His boughs shall spread out far, His beauty shall be like the olive tree’s, His fragrance like that of Lebanon.
content_old: 7 His boughs shall spread out far, His beauty shall be like the olive tree’s, His fragrance like that of Lebanon.

content: 8 They who sit in his shade shall be revived: They shall bring to life new grain, They shall blossom like the vine; His scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
content_old: 8 They who sit in his shade shall be revived: They shall bring to life new grain, They shall blossom like the vine; His scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon.

content: 9 Ephraim shall say: “What more have I to do with idols? When I respond and look to Him, I become like a verdant cypress.” Your fruit is provided by Me.
content_old: 9 Ephraim shall say: “What more have I to do with idols? When I respond and look to Him, I become like a verdant cypress.” Your fruit is provided by Me.
